snippet.title: January 2020 - Decisions that Matter: An Update on Advance Care Planning in Indiana
snippet.description:
Recorded: 01/15/20
Lecturer: Susan Hickman, PhD
*This recording is not eligible for CE/CME

Objectives:
1. Identify updates to the Indiana POST program and related advance care planning legislation.
2. Discuss updates from the National POLST Program.
3. Describe recent research on POLST decision quality.

About Dr. Hickman:
Susan Hickman, PhD, is a geropsychologist, Professor in the Indiana University (IU) School of Nursing and IU School of Medicine, and Director of the IU Center for Aging Research at Regenstrief Institute, Inc.. She has been educating and conducting research on advance care planning for over 20 years.
Dr. Hickman is currently funded by the National Institutes of Nursing Research and the Retirement Research Foundation to evaluate the quality of advance care planning decisions in the nursing facility setting. She is also Co-PI on a National Institute on Aging pragmatic randomized clinical trial to evaluate an ACP Specialist Program for people with Alzheimer’s Disease and related dementias who live in nursing homes. Service activities include Associate Director of the Indiana Patient Preferences coalition and Chair of the National POLST Research and Quality Assurance Committee.

About FCME:
The Charles Warren Fairbanks Center for Medical Ethics sponsors the Fairbanks Ethics Lecture Series as an educational outreach to physicians and staff of Indiana University Health hospitals and interested others in the central Indiana community. Lectures are free, open to all, and do not require pre-registration. Continuing education credit is offered to physicians, nurses, social workers, and chaplains at no charge, regardless of their institutional affiliation. For additional information about the Charles Warren Fairbanks Center for Medical Ethics, please visit our website at fairbankscenter.org.
